item.description:
NEWER STUFF:
Sorry to say this, but I have to make tonight's movie a NoOrg. I have too much to do and not enough energy to do it all. Hope you understand.

This means you can self-organize, but that no discounts will be offered for the tickets/snacks.

Hope you enjoy the movie!

--Dana


NEW STUFF:
The Company Men came and went from the Framingham AMC before we could attend a showing, so I'm changing this week's movie to Tangled. Rapunzel meets Disney in 3D. It's supposed to be cute. And I'm up for cute! How about you?

The movie starts @ 8:15, so let's meet in the ticket lobby at 7:45. Then I'll buy us all tickets and MIB glasses and we can head in to get snacks.

Tickets are going to be a bit more expensive (I think it's $12 instead of $8. which is the same amount of discount as usual) for the 3D version.

After the movie, if we're up for it, let's head to Friday's, as I have a little coupon.

Sorry for the change of movie! If I could have helped it, I would have! :-)

--Dana
508/308-4897

-----------------------------

OLD STUFF:
The Company Men is a must-see for movie fans in the Boston area. Several scenes were filmed with Kevin Costner in Framingham, on Mansfield St. and Prindiville Ave. It's a movie about our "new" economy and how real families are dealing with limitations pressed upon them and how breadwinners are forced to redefine what really matters in life.

SUMMARY:
Bobby Walker is living the American dream: great job, beautiful family, shiny Porsche in the garage. When corporate downsizing leaves him and co-workers Phil Woodward and Gene McClary jobless, the three men are forced to re-define their lives as men, husbands, and fathers. Bobby soon finds himself enduring enthusiastic life coaching, a job building houses for his brother-in-law which does not play to his executive skill set, and perhaps the realization that there is more to life than chasing the bigger, better deal.

THE USUAL STUFF:
We'll meet right inside the theater ticket lobby doors and then I can buy us all discounted tickets ($8.00 each for FMM members and their guests). I also have $3 vouchers each for small sodas and small popcorns (can be used towards a larger size). Exact change makes me like you more.

As always, guests are welcome, just be sure to include them in the RSVP so that I know who/how many to expect.

Please keep your RSVP as up-to-date as possible. And please call me if you're going to be late or need to change your RSVP after I close RSVPs on the site (2 hours before we meet). My cell is: 508/308-4897. I'm also good for directions if you get lost.

After the movie, we'll head to Unos to chat about the movie (and just chat).

I'll update the time a few days before the meetup, so keep an eye on your email!

Hope to see you for The Company Men!

--Dana
508/308-4897
item.name: NoOrg -- Tangled in 3D (was The Company Men)
